pli-tv-kd20:1.5.19.pli: Ajjatagge ovaṭo bhikkhunīnaṃ bhikkhūsu vacanapatho, anovaṭo bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīsu vacanapatho.

pli-tv-kd20:1.5.20.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.

pli-tv-kd20:1.5.21.pli: Sace kho tvaṃ, gotami, ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇheyyāsi, sāva te bhavissati upasampadā”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:1.5.22.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhante ānanda, itthī vā puriso vā daharo, yuvā, maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnahāto uppalamālaṃ vā vassikamālaṃ vā atimuttakamālaṃ vā labhitvā ubhohi hatthehi paṭiggahetvā uttamaṅge sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhāpeyya;
pli-tv-kd20:1.5.22.eng: She replied, “Just as a young woman or man—someone fond of adornments, who has just washed their hair—would receive a garland of lotuses, jasmine, or sandan flowers with both hands and place it on their head,
pli-tv-kd20:1.5.22.comm: For further information on these flowers, see Appendix of Plants.

pli-tv-kd20:1.5.23.pli: evameva kho ahaṃ, bhante, ānanda ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāmi yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīye”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.5.23.eng: so too, do I receive these eight important principles, not to be breached for life.”

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.1.eng: Ānanda then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.3.pli: “paṭiggahitā, bhante, mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā aṭṭha garudhammā, upasampannā bhagavato mātucchā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.3.eng: “Sir, Mahāpajāpati has accepted the eight important principles. Your aunt is now ordained.”

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.4.pli: “Sace, ānanda, nālabhissa mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, ānanda, brahmacariyaṃ abhavissa, vassasahassaṃ saddhammo tiṭṭheyya.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.4.eng: “Ānanda, if women had not been allowed to go forth on this spiritual path proclaimed by the Buddha, the spiritual life would have lasted a long time—the true Teaching would have lasted a thousand years.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.5.pli: Yato ca kho, ānanda, mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito, na dāni, ānanda, brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.5.eng: But now that women have been allowed to go forth, the spiritual life won’t last long—

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.6.pli: Pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassati.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.6.eng: the true Teaching will only last five hundred years.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, yāni kānici kulāni bahutthikāni appapurisakāni, tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhathenakehi;
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.7.eng: Just as families with many women and few men are easily robbed by thieves,

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.8.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.8.eng: so too, the spiritual life doesn’t last long on a spiritual path where women are allowed to go forth.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.9.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne sālikkhette setaṭṭikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ sālikkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti;
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.9.eng: Just as a ripe field of rice affected by whiteheads won’t last long,
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.9.comm: “Whiteheads” renders setaṭṭ(h)ikā, literally, “white bones”. Sp 4.403: Setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti eko pāṇako nāḷimajjhagataṁ kaṇḍaṁ vijjhati, yena viddhattā nikkhantampi sālisīsaṁ khīraṁ gahetuṁ na sakkoti, “The disease called setaṭṭhikā means: an insect penetrates the stem, goes to the middle of the stalk, from the penetration of which the rice grains are not able to get sap.” This seems to be a description of so-called “whiteheads”, pale panicles without rice grains, caused by stem borers.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.10.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.10.eng: so too, the spiritual life doesn’t last long on a spiritual path where women are allowed to go forth.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.11.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne ucchukkhette mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ ucchukkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti;
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.11.eng: Just as a ripe field of sugarcane attacked by red rot won’t last long,
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.11.comm: Sp 4.403: Mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti ucchūnaṁ antorattabhāvo, “Mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti: sugarcane becoming red within.”

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.12.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.12.eng: so too, the spiritual life doesn’t last long on a spiritual path where women are allowed to go forth.

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.13.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, puriso mahato taḷākassa paṭikacceva āḷiṃ bandheyya yāvadeva udakassa anatikkamanāya;
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.13.eng: Just as a man might, as a safeguard, surround a large pool with an embankment to stop the water from overflowing,

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.14.pli: evameva kho, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva bhikkhunīnaṃ aṭṭha garudhammā paññattā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:1.6.14.eng: so too, have I, as a safeguard, laid down the eight important principles, not to be breached for life.”

pli-tv-kd20:1.6.15.eng: The eight important principles for nuns are finished.

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.0.eng: 3. The allowance for the full ordination of nuns

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.1.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:2.1.1.eng: Mahāpajāpati went to the Buddha, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.3.eng: “Sir, what should I do with these Sakyan women?”

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd20:2.1.4.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.5.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd20:2.1.5.eng: after which she bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd20:2.1.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a Teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd20:2.1.7.eng: “I allow monks to give the full ordination to nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.1.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd20:2.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards those nuns said to Mahāpajāpati,

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.3.pli: evañhi bhagavatā paññattaṃ bhikkhūhi bhikkhuniyo upasampādetabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:2.2.3.eng: for the Buddha has laid down that monks should give the full ordination to nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.4.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:2.2.4.eng: Mahāpajāpati then went to Venerable Ānanda, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.6.eng: what the Sakyan women had said.

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.8.pli: evañhi bhagavatā paññattaṃ bhikkhūhi bhikkhuniyo upasampādetabbā’”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd20:2.2.9.eng: And Ānanda went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.10.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.14.pli: evañhi bhagavatā paññattaṃ bhikkhūhi bhikkhuniyo upasampādetabbā’”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:2.2.15.pli: “Yadaggena, ānanda, mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā aṭṭha garudhammā paṭiggahitā, tadeva sā upasampannā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:2.2.15.eng: The Buddha replied, “Mahāpajāpati was ordained from the moment she accepted the eight important principles.”

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.1.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.1.eng: On another occasion Mahāpajāpati went to Venerable Ānanda, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.3.eng: “Venerable Ānanda, I wish to ask the Buddha for a favor:

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.4.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā anujāneyya bhikkhūnañca bhikkhunīnañca yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikamman”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.4.eng: ‘Sir, please allow the monks and nuns to bow down to one another according to seniority, and likewise to rise up for one another, raise their joined palms to one another, and do acts of respect toward one another according to seniority.’”

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.5.eng: Venerable Ānanda went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.9.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā anujāneyya bhikkhūnañca bhikkhunīnañca yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikamman’”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.10.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, ānanda, anavakāso, yaṃ tathāgato anujāneyya mātugāmassa abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.10.eng: The Buddha replied, “It’s impossible, Ānanda, that I would allow bowing down to women, or rising up for them, raising one’s joined palms to them, or doing acts of respect toward them.

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.11.pli: Imehi nāma, ānanda, aññatitthiyā durakkhātadhammā mātugāmassa abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ na karissanti;
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.11.eng: Even the monastics of other religions with their flawed teachings don’t do these things.

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.12.pli: kimaṅgaṃ pana tathāgato anujānissati mātugāmassa abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikamman”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.12.eng: So how, then, could I allow them?”

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.13.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.14.pli: “na, bhikkhave, mātugāmassa abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:3.1.14.eng: “You shouldn’t bow down to a woman, or rise up for, raise your joined palms to, or do acts of respect toward a woman.

pli-tv-kd20:3.1.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.1.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:4.1.1.eng: On another occasion Mahāpajāpati went to the Buddha, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.3.pli: “yāni tāni, bhante, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadāni bhikkhūhi sādhāraṇāni, kathaṃ mayaṃ, bhante, tesu sikkhāpadesu paṭipajjāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:4.1.3.eng: “Sir, how should we practice those training rules that the nuns have in common with the monks?”

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.4.pli: “Yāni tāni, gotami, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadāni bhikkhūhi sādhāraṇāni, yathā bhikkhū sikkhanti tathā tesu sikkhāpadesu sikkhathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:4.1.4.eng: “You should practice them in the same way as the monks do.”

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.5.pli: “Yāni pana tāni, bhante, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadāni bhikkhūhi asādhāraṇāni, kathaṃ mayaṃ, bhante, tesu sikkhāpadesu paṭipajjāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:4.1.5.eng: “And how should we practice those training rules that the nuns don’t have in common with the monks?”

pli-tv-kd20:4.1.6.pli: “Yāni tāni, gotami, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadāni bhikkhūhi asādhāraṇāni, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu sikkhathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:4.1.6.eng: “You should practice them as they have been laid down.”

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.1.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.1.eng: On another occasion Mahāpajāpati went to the Buddha, bowed down,

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.3.pli: “sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yamahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahitattā vihareyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.3.eng: “Sir, please give me a teaching in brief. I’ll then stay by myself, secluded, heedful, energetic, and diligent.”

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.5.pli: ime dhammā sarāgāya saṃvattanti no virāgāya, saññogāya saṃvattanti no visaññogāya, ācayāya saṃvattanti no apacayāya, mahicchatāya saṃvattanti no appicchatāya, asantuṭṭhiyā saṃvattanti no santuṭṭhiyā, saṅgaṇikāya saṃvattanti no pavivekāya, kosajjāya saṃvattanti no vīriyārambhāya, dubbharatāya saṃvattanti no subharatāya;
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.5.eng: lead to passion, not to dispassion; to bondage, not to freedom from bondage; to an increase in things, not to a reduction in things; to great desires, not fewness of desires; to discontent, not to contentment; to socializing, not to seclusion; to laziness, not to being energetic; to being burdensome, not to being unburdensome—

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.7.pli: neso dhammo, neso vinayo, netaṃ satthusāsananti.
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.7.eng: as not the Teaching, not the training, not the Teacher’s instruction.
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.7.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “training” for vinaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.8.pli: Ye ca kho tvaṃ, gotami, dhamme jāneyyāsi—
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.8.eng: But those things that you know

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.9.pli: ime dhammā virāgāya saṃvattanti no sarāgāya, visaññogāya saṃvattanti no saññogāya, apacayāya saṃvattanti no ācayāya, appicchatāya saṃvattanti no mahicchatāya, santuṭṭhiyā saṃvattanti no asantuṭṭhiyā, pavivekāya saṃvattanti no saṅgaṇikāya, vīriyārambhāya saṃvattanti no kosajjāya, subharatāya saṃvattanti no dubbharatāya;
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.9.eng: lead to dispassion, not to passion; to freedom from bondage, not to bondage; to a reduction in things, not to an increase in things; to fewness of desires, not to great desires; to contentment, not to discontent; to seclusion, not to socializing; to being energetic, not to laziness; to being unburdensome, not to being unburdensome—

pli-tv-kd20:5.1.11.pli: eso dhammo, eso vinayo, etaṃ satthusāsanan”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:5.1.11.eng: as the Teaching, the training, the Teacher’s instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhunīnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ na uddisīyati.
pli-tv-kd20:6.1.1.eng: At that time the Monastic Code was not being recited to the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.3.eng: “The Monastic Code should be recited to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.4.comm: I follow the Pali of the PTS version. MS reads, “The monks thought”.

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.5.eng: “Who should recite the Monastic Code to the nuns?”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.7.eng: “The monks should recite the Monastic Code to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.1.8.eng: Soon afterwards the monks went to the nuns’ dwelling place to recite the Monastic Code.
pli-tv-kd20:6.1.8.comm: “Nunnery” renders upassaya. According to the word definition at Bu Pc 23, this includes any place where a nun stays. In other words, it spans anything from a single hut, see Bi Pc 35, to a monastery. The Jain text The Ācārāṅga-sūtra, contains a passage that describes an upassaya as including a grassy area, that is, it must have been a compound of buildings or a monastery: “A layman might, for the sake of a mendicant ... cutting and clipping the grass outside or within the upāśraya (= upassaya).” See Jacobi, Hermann, trans. “Jaina Sutras Part I”. Motilal Babarsidass, 1964, p. 94.

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.10.pli: “jāyāyo imā imesaṃ, jāriyo imā imesaṃ, idāni ime imāhi saddhiṃ abhiramissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.1.10.eng: “They’re their wives! They’re their mistresses! Now they’re going to enjoy themselves together.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.12.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code to the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.14.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi bhikkhunīnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.1.14.eng: Nuns should recite the Monastic Code to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.1.19.eng: how to recite the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo āpattiṃ na paṭikaronti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.2.1.eng: At that time the nuns did not make amends for their offenses.

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.3.eng: “A nun should make amends for her offenses.

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.4.eng: If she doesn’t, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.9.eng: how to make amends for an offense.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.11.eng: “Who should receive the confession of offenses from the nuns?”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.13.eng: “The monks should receive the confession of offenses from the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.14.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi bhikkhuṃ passitvā pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā āpattiṃ paṭikaronti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.2.14.eng: Soon afterwards, when the nuns saw a monk on a street, in a cul-de-sac, or at an intersection, they would put down their bowls, arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and make amends for their offenses.

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.16.pli: “jāyāyo imā imesaṃ, jāriyo imā imesaṃ, rattiṃ vimānetvā idāni khamāpentī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.2.16.eng: “They’re their wives! They’re their mistresses! Having offended them at night, they now ask for forgiveness.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.18.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t receive confessions from the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.19.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:6.2.20.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi bhikkhunīnaṃ āpattiṃ paṭiggahetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.2.20.eng: Nuns should receive the confession of offenses from the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhunīnaṃ kammaṃ na kariyati.
pli-tv-kd20:6.3.1.eng: At that time the nuns’ legal procedures were not being done.

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.3.eng: “Monks, I allow the doing of the nuns’ legal procedures.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.7.eng: “The monks should do the nuns’ legal procedures.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena katakammā bhikkhuniyo rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi bhikkhuṃ passitvā pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā khamāpenti “evaṃ nūna kātabban”ti maññamānā.
pli-tv-kd20:6.3.8.eng: Soon afterwards, when nuns who had had a legal procedure done against them saw a monk on a street, in a cul-de-sac, or at an intersection, they would put down their bowls, arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and ask for forgiveness, thinking, “This is the way to do it.”
pli-tv-kd20:6.3.8.comm: “Who had had a legal procedure done against them” renders katakammā. The commentary is silent, but elsewhere katadaṇḍakamma (e.g. at Kd 1:44.1.1) and kammakata (e.g. at Bu Ss 13:2.45) mean “who has had a legal procedure (of penalization) done against them”.

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.10.pli: “jāyāyo imā imesaṃ, jāriyo imā imesaṃ, rattiṃ vimānetvā idāni khamāpentī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.3.10.eng: “They’re their wives! They’re their mistresses! Having offended them at night, they now ask for forgiveness.”

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.12.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t do the nuns’ legal procedures.

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:6.3.14.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi bhikkhunīnaṃ kammaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:6.3.14.eng: The nuns should do the nuns’ legal procedures.”

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo saṅghamajjhe bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.1.eng: On one occasion the nuns were arguing and disputing in the midst of the Sangha, attacking one another verbally,

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.2.eng: and they were not able to resolve that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.4.eng: “I allow the monks to resolve the nuns’ legal issues.”

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhikkhunīnaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamenti.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.5.eng: Soon afterwards the monks were resolving a legal issue for the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.6.pli: Tasmiṃ kho pana adhikaraṇe vinicchiyamāne dissanti bhikkhuniyo kammappattāyopi āpattigāminiyopi.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.6.eng: While they were discussing that legal issue, there were nuns who deserved to have a legal procedure done against them and who had committed an offense.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.6.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.410: Kammappattāyopīti kammārahāpi. Āpattigāminiyopīti āpattiāpannāyopi, “Kammappattāyopi: who deserved a legal procedure. Āpattigāminiyopi: who had committed an offense.”

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.8.pli: “sādhu, bhante, ayyāva bhikkhunīnaṃ kammaṃ karontu, ayyāva bhikkhunīnaṃ āpattiṃ paṭiggaṇhantu;
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.8.eng: “Venerables, please do the procedure against those nuns and receive their confession of offenses,

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.9.pli: evañhi bhagavatā paññattaṃ bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.9.eng: for the Buddha has laid down that the nuns’ legal issues should be resolved by the monks.”

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.11.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnaṃ kammaṃ āropetvā bhikkhunīnaṃ niyyādetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.11.eng: “Monks, I allow you to determine the nature of the nuns’ legal procedure, before handing it over to the nuns to do it.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.11.comm: “Determine the nature of the nuns’ legal procedure” renders bhikkhunīnaṁ kammaṁ āropetvā. Sp 4.410: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnaṁ kammaṁ ropetvā niyyādetunti ettha tajjanīyādīsu “idaṁ nāma kammaṁ etissā kātabban”ti evaṁ ropetvā “taṁ dāni tumheva karothā”ti niyyādetabbaṁ, “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnaṁ kammaṁ ropetvā niyyādetuṁ here, in regard to (legal procedures of) condemnation, etc., saying, ‘This kind of legal procedure is to be done toward this one’, having fixed it thus, it is to be handed over (to the nuns), saying, ‘Now you should do it against her.’”

pli-tv-kd20:7.1.12.pli: bhikkhunīhi bhikkhunīnaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnaṃ āpattiṃ āropetvā bhikkhunīnaṃ niyyādetuṃ, bhikkhunīhi bhikkhunīnaṃ āpattiṃ paṭiggahetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:7.1.12.eng: And I allow you to charge a nun with an offense, before handing it over to the nuns for them to receive the confession.”

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī satta vassāni bhagavantaṃ anubandhā hoti vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇantī.
pli-tv-kd20:8.1.1.eng: At that time a nun who was a pupil of the nun Uppalavaṇṇā had followed the Buddha around for seven years to learn the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.2.eng: But because of her absentmindedness, she repeatedly forgot what she had learned.

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.4.eng: that the Buddha wanted to go to Sāvatthī,

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.6.pli: “ahaṃ kho satta vassāni bhagavantaṃ anubandhiṃ vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇantī.

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.7.pli: Tassā me muṭṭhassatiniyā gahito gahito mussati.

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.8.pli: Dukkaraṃ kho pana mātugāmena yāvajīvaṃ satthāraṃ anubandhituṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:8.1.8.eng: “It’s hard for a woman to follow the Teacher around all her life.

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.10.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd20:8.1.10.eng: She told the nuns what she had thought,

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.11.eng: who in turn told the monks,

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.12.eng: who then told the Buddha. The Buddha said,

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.13.eng: “I allow monks to teach the Monastic Law to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:8.1.14.eng: The first section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Vesālī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo kaddamodakena osiñcanti—
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.4.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six tried to attract the nuns by splashing them with muddy water.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.7.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t splash the nuns with muddy water.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.9.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tassa bhikkhuno daṇḍakammaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.9.eng: I allow the nuns to penalize a monk who acts like this.”
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.9.comm: It is not clear from the Pali whether it is the monks or the nuns who should penalize the monk. The discussion in the commentary at Sp 4.411, however, makes it clear that it is the nuns who impose the penalty. The commentary explains that the penalty is imposed by assembling at the nunnery, bhikkhunupassaye, and those assembled then use the term ayya when referring to the monk who acted inappropriately. Only nuns use this term when referring to monks.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.11.eng: “What sort of penalty should they impose?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.13.eng: “The Sangha of nuns shouldn’t pay respect to such a monk.”
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.13.comm: Sp 4.411: Avandiyo so bhikkhave bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena kātabboti bhikkhunupassaye sannipatitvā “asuko nāma ayyo bhikkhunīnaṁ apasādanīyaṁ dasseti, etassa ayyassa avandiyakaraṇaṁ ruccatī”ti evaṁ tikkhattuṁ sāvetabbaṁ. Ettāvatā avandiyo kato hoti, “‘The Sangha of nuns shouldn’t pay respect to such a monk’: Having assembled in the nuns’ quarters, this proclamation is to be done three times: ‘The venerable so-and-so is disagreeable toward the nuns. It is proper not to pay respects to this venerable.’ In this way not-paying respect is done.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.14.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.14.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six tried to attract the nuns by exposing their bodies to them,

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.15.pli: ūruṃ vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassenti, aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassenti, bhikkhuniyo obhāsenti, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ sampayojenti—
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.15.eng: by exposing their thighs to them, and by exposing their genitals to them. And they spoke indecently to the nuns and associated inappropriately with them.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.18.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā kāyo vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassetabbo, na ūru vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassetabbo, na aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhunīnaṃ dassetabbaṃ, na bhikkhuniyo obhāsitabbā, na bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ sampayojetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.18.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t expose your body to the nuns; you shouldn’t expose your thighs to the nuns; you shouldn’t expose your genitals to the nuns; you shouldn’t speak indecently to the nuns; and you shouldn’t associate inappropriately with the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.19.eng: If you associate inappropriately with the nuns, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.20.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tassa bhikkhuno daṇḍakammaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.1.20.eng: I allow the nuns to penalize a monk who acts like this.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.22.eng: “What sort of penalty can they impose?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.1.24.eng: “The Sangha of nuns shouldn’t pay respect to such a monk.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhuṃ kaddamodakena osiñcanti—
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six tried to attract a monk by splashing him with muddy water.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.4.eng: “A nun shouldn’t splash a monk with muddy water.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.5.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tassā bhikkhuniyā daṇḍakammaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.6.eng: I allow you to penalize such a nun.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.8.eng: “What sort of penalty can we impose?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.10.eng: “I allow you to place restrictions on her.”
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.10.comm: Sp 4.411: Āvaraṇanti vihārappavesane nivāraṇaṁ, “Restrictions: a hindrance on entering the monastery.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.11.eng: She did not adhere to the restrictions.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.13.eng: “I allow you to cancel her half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.14.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo kāyaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassenti, thanaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassenti, ūruṃ vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassenti, aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassenti, bhikkhū obhāsenti, bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ sampayojenti—
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.14.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six tried to attract the monks by exposing their bodies to them, by exposing their breasts to them, by exposing their thighs to them, and by exposing their genitals to them. And they spoke indecently to the monks and associated inappropriately with them.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.17.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā kāyo vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassetabbo …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.17.eng: “A nun shouldn’t expose her body to the monks;

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.18.pli: na thano vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassetabbo, na ūru vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassetabbo, na aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā bhikkhūnaṃ dassetabbaṃ, na bhikkhū obhāsitabbā, na bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ sampayojetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.18.eng: she shouldn’t expose her breasts to the monks; she shouldn’t expose her thighs to the monks; she shouldn’t expose her genitals to the monks; she shouldn’t speak indecently to the monks; and she shouldn’t associate inappropriately with the monks.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.19.eng: If she associates inappropriately with the monks, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.20.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tassā bhikkhuniyā daṇḍakammaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.2.20.eng: I allow the monks to penalize such a nun.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.22.eng: “What sort of penalty can we impose?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.24.eng: “I allow you to place restrictions on her.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.25.eng: She did not adhere to the restrictions.

pli-tv-kd20:9.2.27.eng: “I allow you to cancel her half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.2.pli: “kappati nu kho ovādaṭṭhapitāya bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ uposathaṃ kātuṃ, na nu kho kappatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.2.eng: “Is it allowable or not to do the observance-day ceremony with a nun whose half-monthly instruction has been canceled?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.4.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, ovādaṭṭhapitāya bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ uposatho kātabbo, yāva na taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ hotī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.4.eng: “Until that legal issue has been resolved, it’s not allowable to do the observance-day ceremony with a nun whose half-monthly instruction has been canceled.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī ovādaṃ ṭhapetvā cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.5.eng: On one occasion Venerable Udāyī canceled the half-monthly instruction and then set out wandering.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.6.eng: The nuns complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo udāyī ovādaṃ ṭhapetvā cārikaṃ pakkamissatī”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.9.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t cancel the half-monthly instruction and then set out wandering.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bālā abyattā ovādaṃ ṭhapenti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.11.eng: At that time there were ignorant and incompetent monks who canceled the half-monthly instruction.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.11.comm: The word “monks” is missing from the Pali, but is found in other versions of the Tipiṭaka, such as SRT.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.13.eng: “A monk who’s ignorant and incompetent shouldn’t cancel the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.14.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ovādaṃ ṭhapenti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.15.eng: At that time there were monks who canceled the half-monthly instruction without reason.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.17.eng: “A monk shouldn’t cancel the half-monthly instruction without reason.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.18.eng: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.19.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ovādaṃ ṭhapetvā vinicchayaṃ na denti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.19.eng: At that time there were monks who did not investigate after canceling the half-monthly instruction.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.19.comm: “Did not investigate” renders vinicchayaṁ na denti. The commentaries are silent. I take it to mean that the monks did not investigate whether the nun had changed her behavior.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.21.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, ovādaṃ ṭhapetvā vinicchayo na dātabbo.
pli-tv-kd20:9.3.21.eng: “You should investigate after canceling the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.3.22.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ na gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.1.eng: At that time there were nuns who did not go to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.3.eng: “A nun should go to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.4.eng: If she doesn’t, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sabbo bhikkhunisaṅgho ovādaṃ gacchati.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.5.eng: At that time the entire Sangha of nuns went to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.7.pli: “jāyāyo imā imesaṃ, jāriyo imā imesaṃ, idāni ime imāhi saddhiṃ abhiramissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.7.eng: “They’re their wives! They’re their mistresses! Now they’re going to enjoy themselves together.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.9.eng: “The whole Sangha of nuns shouldn’t go to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.10.eng: If it does, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.11.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, catūhi pañcahi bhikkhunīhi ovādaṃ gantun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.11.eng: Four or five nuns should go to the instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena catasso pañca bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.12.eng: Soon afterwards four or five nuns went to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.14.pli: “jāyāyo imā imesaṃ, jāriyo imā imesaṃ, idāni ime imāhi saddhiṃ abhiramissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.14.eng: “They’re their wives! They’re their mistresses! Now they’re going to enjoy themselves together.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.16.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, catūhi pañcahi bhikkhunīhi ovādo gantabbo.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.16.eng: “Four or five nuns shouldn’t go to the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.17.eng: If they do, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.18.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, dve tisso bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.18.eng: Two or three nuns should go to the instruction.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.18.comm: This is curious because, according to Bi Pc 58, a nun must go to the instruction, the ovāda. The ensuing narrative, however, makes it clear that this is not about the instruction as such, but about asking for the day of the observance day and the right time to approach for the instruction. In other words, this is about Bi Pc 59, not Bi Pc 58. It is possible that the Pali text here is corrupted and that the original phrasing was closer to what we find at Bi Pc 59.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.19.pli: Ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.19.eng: They should go to a monk, arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, bow down at his feet, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.20.pli: ‘bhikkhunisaṅgho, ayya, bhikkhusaṅghassa pāde vandati, ovādūpasaṅkamanañca yācati;
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.20.eng: ‘Venerable, the Sangha of nuns bows down at the feet of the Sangha of monks and asks to come for the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.21.eng: Please allow the Sangha of nuns to come for the instruction.’

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.22.pli: Tena bhikkhunā pātimokkhuddesako upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.22.eng: That monk should go to the reciter of the Monastic Code and tell him

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.23.pli: ‘bhikkhunisaṅgho, bhante, bhikkhusaṅghassa pāde vandati, ovādūpasaṅkamanañca yācati;

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.26.eng: ‘Is there anyone who has been appointed as an instructor of the nuns?’

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.27.pli: Sace hoti koci bhikkhu bhikkhunovādako sammato, pātimokkhuddesakena vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.27.eng: If there is, the reciter should say,

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.28.pli: ‘itthannāmo bhikkhu bhikkhunovādako sammato, taṃ bhikkhunisaṅgho upasaṅkamatū’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.28.eng: ‘Monk so-and-so has been appointed. The Sangha of nuns should approach him.’

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.29.pli: Sace na hoti koci bhikkhu bhikkhunovādako sammato, pātimokkhuddesakena vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.29.eng: If there isn’t, the reciter should say,

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.31.pli: Sace koci ussahati bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ, so ca hoti aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato, sammannitvā vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.31.eng: If there is someone who is suitable and who has the eight required qualities, he should be appointed. The reciter should then say,
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.31.comm: These are the eight qualities listed at Bu Pc 21:2.26.

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.32.pli: ‘itthannāmo bhikkhu bhikkhunovādako sammato, taṃ bhikkhunisaṅgho upasaṅkamatū’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.32.eng: ‘Monk so-and-so has been appointed. The Sangha of nuns should approach him.’

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.33.pli: Sace na koci ussahati bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ, pātimokkhuddesakena vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.33.eng: If no-one is able to instruct the nuns, the reciter of the Monastic Code should say,

pli-tv-kd20:9.4.34.pli: ‘natthi koci bhikkhu bhikkhunovādako sammato, pāsādikena bhikkhunisaṅgho sampādetū’”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.4.34.eng: ‘No monk has been appointed as an instructor of the nuns. The Sangha of nuns should carry on with serenity.’”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ovādaṃ na gaṇhanti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.1.eng: On one occasion there were monks who did not agree to give the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.3.eng: “You should agree to give the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.4.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu bālo hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.5.eng: On one occasion the nuns went to a monk who was ignorant

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.7.eng: “Venerable, please agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.9.eng: How can I agree to give the instruction?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.11.eng: for the Buddha has laid down

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.12.eng: that a monk should agree to give the instruction to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.14.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā bālaṃ, avasesehi ovādaṃ gahetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.14.eng: “Except if you’re ignorant, you should agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.15.eng: On one occasion the nuns went to a monk who was sick

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.17.eng: “Venerable, please agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.19.eng: How can I agree to give the instruction?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.21.eng: for the Buddha has laid down

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.22.eng: that a monk should agree to give the instruction to the nuns, except if he’s ignorant.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.24.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā bālaṃ, ṭhapetvā gilānaṃ, avasesehi ovādaṃ gahetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.24.eng: “Except if you’re ignorant or sick, you should agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.25.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gamiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.25.eng: On one occasion the nuns went to a monk who was about to depart

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.27.eng: “Venerable, please agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.29.eng: How can I agree to give the instruction?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.31.eng: for the Buddha has laid down

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.32.pli: ṭhapetvā bālaṃ, ṭhapetvā gilānaṃ, avasesehi ovādo gahetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.32.eng: that a monk should agree to give the instruction to the nuns, except if he’s ignorant or sick.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.34.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā bālaṃ, ṭhapetvā gilānaṃ, ṭhapetvā gamikaṃ, avasesehi ovādaṃ gahetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.34.eng: “Except if you’re ignorant, sick, or about to depart, you should agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.35.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu araññe viharati.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.35.eng: On one occasion the nuns went to a monk who was staying in the wilderness

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.37.eng: “Venerable, please agree to give the half-monthly instruction.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.38.eng: “But I’m staying in the wilderness, sisters.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.39.eng: How can I agree to give the instruction?”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.41.eng: for the Buddha has laid down

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.42.pli: ṭhapetvā bālaṃ, ṭhapetvā gilānaṃ, ṭhapetvā gamikaṃ, avasesehi ovādo gahetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.42.eng: that a monk should agree to give the instruction to the nuns, except if he’s ignorant, sick, or about to depart.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.44.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, āraññikena bhikkhunā ovādaṃ gahetuṃ, saṅketañca kātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.44.eng: “If you’re staying in the wilderness, you should agree to give the half-monthly instruction. You should make an appointment, saying,

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.46.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ovādaṃ gahetvā na ārocenti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.46.eng: At that time there were monks who agreed to give the half-monthly instruction without informing.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.46.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.415: Na ārocentīti pātimokkhuddesakassa na ārocenti, “‘Without informing’: without informing the reciter of the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.48.eng: “When you have agreed to give the half-monthly instruction, you should inform.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.49.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.50.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ovādaṃ gahetvā na paccāharanti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.50.eng: At that time there were monks who had agreed to give the half-monthly instruction, but did not return to give it.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.52.eng: “You should return to give the half-monthly instruction.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.53.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.54.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo saṅketaṃ na gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd20:9.5.54.eng: On one occasion the nuns did not go to the appointment.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.56.eng: “A nun should go to the appointment.

pli-tv-kd20:9.5.57.eng: If she doesn’t, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo dīghāni kāyabandhanāni dhārenti, teheva phāsukā nāmenti.
pli-tv-kd20:10.1.1.eng: At that time there were nuns who wore long belts that they made into corsets.
pli-tv-kd20:10.1.1.comm: Sp 4.416: Phāsukā namentīti gihidārikāyo viya ghanapaṭṭakena kāyabandhanena phāsukā namanatthāya bandhanti, “Phāsukā namenti means: using the thick strips of the waistband, they made ribs for the purpose of shaping, like lay girls.” Vin-vn-ṭ 2954: Na phāsukā nametabbāti majjhimassa tanubhāvatthāya gāmadārikā viya phāsulikā na nāmetabbā; “Na phāsukā nametabbā: village-girl ribs are not to be made for the purpose of making one of middle size slender.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.3.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.5.eng: “A nun shouldn’t wear a long belt.

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.6.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā ekapariyākataṃ kāyabandhanaṃ, na ca tena phāsukā nāmetabbā.
pli-tv-kd20:10.1.7.eng: I allow a nun to wear a belt that goes once around her body, but she shouldn’t make a corset out of it.

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.8.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo vilīvena paṭṭena phāsukā nāmenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.1.9.eng: There were nuns who made corsets out of strips of split bamboo,

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.20.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.22.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā vilīvena paṭṭena phāsukā nāmetabbā …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.1.22.eng: “A nun shouldn’t make a corset out of strips of split bamboo, strips of leather, strips of fabric, interlaced fabric, rolled-up fabric, strips of cloth, interlaced cloth, rolled-up cloth, interlaced strings,

pli-tv-kd20:10.1.24.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo aṭṭhillena jaghanaṃ ghaṃsāpenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.2.1.eng: There were nuns who had their loins rubbed with bones,

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.2.pli: gohanukena jaghanaṃ koṭṭāpenti, hatthaṃ koṭṭāpenti, hatthakocchaṃ koṭṭāpenti, pādaṃ koṭṭāpenti, pādakocchaṃ koṭṭāpenti, ūruṃ koṭṭāpenti, mukhaṃ koṭṭāpenti, dantamaṃsaṃ koṭṭāpenti.
pli-tv-kd20:10.2.2.eng: their loins tapped with a cow’s jaw bone, their palms tapped, the backs of their hands tapped, the soles of their feet tapped, the tops of their feet tapped, their thighs tapped, their faces tapped, and their gums tapped with a cow’s jaw bone.
pli-tv-kd20:10.2.2.comm: “The backs of their hands” renders hatthakoccha. Sp 4.416: Hatthakocchanti piṭṭhihatthaṁ, “Hatthakoccha means the back of the hand.” According to PED piṭṭhi and tala refer to opposite sides of the hand and the foot, with tala referring to the palm/sole.

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.4.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.6.eng: “A nun shouldn’t have her loins rubbed with bones, her loins tapped with a cow’s jaw bone, her palms tapped, the back of her hands tapped, the soles of her feet tapped, the top of her feet tapped, her thighs tapped, her face tapped,

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.7.eng: or her gums tapped with a cow’s jaw bone.

pli-tv-kd20:10.2.8.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo mukhaṃ ālimpanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.3.1.eng: The nuns from the group of six used facial ointments,

pli-tv-kd20:10.3.2.pli: mukhaṃ ummaddenti, mukhaṃ cuṇṇenti, manosilikāya mukhaṃ lañchenti, aṅgarāgaṃ karonti, mukharāgaṃ karonti, aṅgarāgamukharāgaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd20:10.3.2.eng: applied facial creams, powdered their face, applied rouge to their face, wore cosmetics on their body, wore cosmetics on their face, and wore cosmetics on their body and face.
pli-tv-kd20:10.3.2.comm: “Applied facial creams” renders mukhaṁ ummaddenti. The verb ummaddeti normally just means “rubs” or “massages”, but here the contexts required the application of some kind of cosmetic or cream. Sp 3.247: Ummaddentīti nānāummaddanehi ummaddenti, “Ummaddenti: they rub with various creams.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.3.4.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.3.7.pli: na mukhaṃ ummadditabbaṃ, na mukhaṃ cuṇṇetabbaṃ, na manosilikāya mukhaṃ lañchetabbaṃ, na aṅgarāgo kātabbo, na mukharāgo kātabbo, na aṅgarāgamukharāgo kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd20:10.3.7.eng: apply facial creams, powder her face, apply rouge to her face, wear cosmetics on her body, wear cosmetics on her face, or wear cosmetics on her body and face.

pli-tv-kd20:10.3.8.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo avaṅgaṃ karonti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.1.eng: The nuns from the group of six made up their eyes,
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.1.comm: Sp 4.417: Avaṅgaṁ karontīti akkhī añjantiyo avaṅgadese adhomukhaṁ lekhaṁ karonti, “Avaṅgaṁ karontīti: they made up the eyes by making a downward line at the outer corner of the eye.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.2.pli: visesakaṃ karonti, olokanakena olokenti, sāloke tiṭṭhanti;
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.2.eng: applied facial marks, stared out the windows, exposed themselves to view,
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.2.comm: Sp 4.417: Visesakanti gaṇḍappadese vicitrasaṇṭhānaṁ visesakaṁ karonti. Olokentīti vātapānaṁ vivaritvā vīthiṁ olokenti. Sāloke tiṭṭhantīti dvāraṁ vivaritvā upaḍḍhakāyaṁ dassentiyo tiṭṭhanti, “Visesaka: they made a colored mark on the cheek. Olokenti: having opened a window, they looked at the street. Sāloke tiṭṭhanti: having opened a door, they stood showing half their body.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.3.pli: naccaṃ kārāpenti, vesiṃ vuṭṭhāpenti, pānāgāraṃ ṭhapenti, sūnaṃ ṭhapenti, āpaṇaṃ pasārenti, vaḍḍhiṃ payojenti, vaṇijjaṃ payojenti, dāsaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, dāsiṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, kammakāraṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, kammakāriṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, tiracchānagataṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, harītakapakkikaṃ pakiṇanti, namatakaṃ dhārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.3.eng: organized dancing, appointed sex workers, set up bars, set up slaughterhouses, set up shops, made loans, engaged in trade, were attended on by slaves, were attended on by servants, were attended on by animals, traded in raw and cooked greens, and wore felt.
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.3.comm: “Appointed sex workers” renders vesiṁ vuṭṭhāpenti. Sp 3.327: Sālavatiṁ kumāriṁ gaṇikaṁ vuṭṭhāpesīti … gaṇikaṭṭhāne ṭhapesunti attho, “Appointed the girl Sālavatī as courtesan: … the meaning is that they placed her in the position of courtesan.” “Traded in raw and cooked greens” renders haritakapakkikaṁ pakiṇanti. Sp 4.417: Haritakapakkikaṁ pakiṇantīti haritakañceva pakkañca pakiṇanti; pakiṇṇakāpaṇaṁ pasārentīti vuttaṁ hoti, “Haritakapakkikaṁ pakiṇanti means she traded in greens and what is cooked; it is said that she set up shop for trading.” Sp-yoj 4.417: “Haritakañceva pakkañcā”ti … Tattha haritakanti haritameva paṇṇaṁ. Pakkantiseditaṁ paṇṇaṁ, “Haritakañceva pakkañcā: … In this haritaka is just green leaves. Pakka is heated leaves.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.5.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.7.eng: “A nun shouldn’t make up her eyes,

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.8.pli: na visesakaṃ kātabbaṃ, na olokanakena oloketabbaṃ, na sāloke ṭhātabbaṃ, na naccaṃ kārāpetabbaṃ, na vesī vuṭṭhāpetabbā, na pānāgāraṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ, na sūnā ṭhapetabbā, na āpaṇo pasāretabbo, na vaḍḍhi payojetabbā, na vaṇijjā payojetabbā, na dāso upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na dāsī upaṭṭhāpetabbā, na kammakāro upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na kammakārī upaṭṭhāpetabbā, na tiracchānagato upaṭṭhāpetabbo, na harītakapakkikaṃ pakiṇitabbaṃ, na namatakaṃ dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:10.4.8.eng: apply facial marks, stare out a window, expose herself to view, organize dancing, appoint a sex worker, set up a bar, set up a slaughterhouse, set up a shop, make a loan, engage in trade, be attended on by a slave, be attended on by a servant, be attended on by animals, trade in raw and cooked greens, or wear felt.

pli-tv-kd20:10.4.9.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:10.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sabbanīlakāni cīvarāni dhārenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd20:10.5.1.eng: The nuns from the group of six wore entirely blue robes,

pli-tv-kd20:10.5.2.pli: sabbapītakāni cīvarāni dhārenti, sabbalohitakāni cīvarāni dhārenti, sabbamañjiṭṭhikāni cīvarāni dhārenti, sabbakaṇhāni cīvarāni dhārenti, sabbamahāraṅgarattāni cīvarāni dhārenti, sabbamahānāmarattāni cīvarāni dhārenti, acchinnadasāni cīvarāni dhārenti, dīghadasāni cīvarāni dhārenti, pupphadasāni cīvarāni dhārenti, phaladasāni cīvarāni dhārenti, kañcukaṃ dhārenti, tirīṭakaṃ dhārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:10.5.2.eng: entirely yellow robes, entirely red robes, entirely magenta robes, entirely black robes, entirely orange robes, entirely beige robes, robes with borders made from a single piece of cloth, robes with long borders, robes with floral borders, robes with borders decorated with fruit designs, close-fitting jackets, and Lodh-tree robes.

pli-tv-kd20:10.5.4.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:10.5.6.eng: “A nun shouldn’t wear entirely blue robes, entirely yellow robes, entirely red robes, entirely magenta robes, entirely black robes, entirely orange robes, entirely beige robes, robes with borders made from a single piece of cloth, robes with long borders, robes with floral borders, robes with borders decorated with fruit designs, close-fitting jackets,
pli-tv-kd20:10.5.6.comm: For further explanations of some of these, see comments at Kd 8:29.1.6, Kd 8:29.1.7, and Kd 8:29.1.13.

pli-tv-kd20:10.5.8.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī kālaṃ karontī evamāha—
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.1.eng: On one occasion a nun who was dying said,

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.2.eng: “When I’m dead, give my requisites to the Sangha.”
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.2.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “requisites” for parikkhāra, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.3.pli: Tattha bhikkhū ca bhikkhuniyo ca vivadanti—
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.3.eng: The monks and the nuns argued with one another, saying

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.6.pli: “Bhikkhunī ce, bhikkhave, kālaṃ karontī evaṃ vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.7.pli: ‘mamaccayena mayhaṃ parikkhāro saṅghassa hotū’ti, anissaro tattha bhikkhusaṅgho, bhikkhunisaṅghassevetaṃ.

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.9.pli: sāmaṇerī ce, bhikkhave, kālaṃ karontī evaṃ vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.9.eng: or a dying novice nun says,

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.10.pli: ‘mamaccayena mayhaṃ parikkhāro saṅghassa hotū’ti, anissaro tattha bhikkhusaṅgho, bhikkhunisaṅghassevetaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.10.eng: ‘When I’m dead, give my requisites to the Sangha,’ then they’re for the Sangha of nuns, not for the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.11.pli: Bhikkhu ce, bhikkhave, kālaṃ karonto evaṃ vadeyya—

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.12.pli: ‘mamaccayena mayhaṃ parikkhāro saṅghassa hotū’ti, anissaro tattha bhikkhunisaṅgho, bhikkhusaṅghassevetaṃ.

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.16.pli: añño ce, bhikkhave, koci kālaṃ karonto evaṃ vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.16.eng: or anyone else who is dying says,

pli-tv-kd20:11.1.17.pli: ‘mamaccayena mayhaṃ parikkhāro saṅghassa hotū’ti, anissaro tattha bhikkhunisaṅgho, bhikkhusaṅghassevetan”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:11.1.17.eng: ‘When I’m dead, give my requisites to the Sangha,’ then they’re for the Sangha of monks, not for the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī purāṇamallī bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:12.1.1.eng: At one time a woman who was a former wrestler went forth as a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.2.pli: Sā rathikāya dubbalakaṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā aṃsakūṭena pahāraṃ datvā pātesi.
pli-tv-kd20:12.1.2.eng: Seeing a weak monk on a street, she hit him with her shoulder. He fell over.

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.3.eng: The monks complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.4.eng: “How could a nun hit a monk?”

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.7.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:12.1.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā bhikkhuṃ passitvā dūratova okkamitvā maggaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:12.1.8.eng: When a nun sees a monk coming, she should make way for him by stepping off the path.”

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī pavutthapatikā jārena gabbhinī hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.1.eng: At one time a certain woman became pregnant by a lover while her husband was away.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.2.pli: Sā gabbhaṃ pātetvā kulūpikaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.2.eng: After having an abortion, she said to the nun who was associating with her family,

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.3.eng: “Venerable, please take this fetus away in your almsbowl.”

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.4.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī taṃ gabbhaṃ patte pakkhipitvā saṅghāṭiyā paṭicchādetvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.4.eng: The nun did as asked, covered her bowl with her upper robe, and left.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena piṇḍacārikena bhikkhunā samādānaṃ kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.5.eng: At that time a certain alms-collecting monk had resolved

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.6.pli: “yāhaṃ paṭhamaṃ bhikkhaṃ labhissāmi, na taṃ adatvā bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā paribhuñjissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.6.eng: not to eat without giving the first almsfood he had received to another monk or nun.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ bhikkhuniṃ passitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.7.eng: He saw that nun and said,

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.10.eng: He repeated his request a second

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.11.pli: tatiyampi kho so bhikkhu taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.15.pli: ‘yāhaṃ paṭhamaṃ bhikkhaṃ labhissāmi, na taṃ adatvā bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā paribhuñjissāmī’ti.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.16.eng: and again requested her to accept some almsfood.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.17.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tena bhikkhunā nippīḷiyamānā nīharitvā pattaṃ dassesi—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.17.eng: Being pressured by that monk, the nun brought out her bowl and showed it to him, saying,

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.18.eng: “See sir, there’s a fetus in my bowl.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.20.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.20.eng: But he complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.21.eng: “How could a nun take a fetus away in her bowl?”

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.22.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.23.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.23.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.24.eng: “How could a nun take a fetus away in her bowl?”

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.26.eng: “A nun shouldn’t take a fetus away in her bowl.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.27.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:13.1.28.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā bhikkhuṃ passitvā nīharitvā pattaṃ dassetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.1.28.eng: When a nun sees a monk, she should bring out her almsbowl and show it to him.”

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhuṃ passitvā parivattetvā pattamūlaṃ dassenti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, when the nuns from the group of six saw a monk, they turned their bowls upside down and showed him the bottom.

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.2.eng: The monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhuṃ passitvā parivattetvā pattamūlaṃ dassessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.2.3.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.5.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā bhikkhuṃ passitvā parivattetvā pattamūlaṃ dassetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:13.2.5.eng: “When a nun sees a monk, she shouldn’t turn her almsbowl upside down and show him the bottom.

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.6.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā bhikkhuṃ passitvā ukkujjitvā pattaṃ dassetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:13.2.7.eng: When a nun sees a monk, she should turn her bowl upright and then show it to him.

pli-tv-kd20:13.2.8.pli: Yañca patte āmisaṃ hoti, tena ca bhikkhu nimantetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:13.2.8.eng: And she should offer whatever food is in her bowl to that monk.”

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ rathikāya purisabyañjanaṃ chaḍḍitaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:14.1.1.eng: On one occasion a penis had been thrown out on a street in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.5.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo upassayaṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:14.1.5.eng: When they had returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, they told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd20:14.1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.7.eng: “How could those nuns stare at a penis?”

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.8.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.9.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. He said,

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.10.eng: “A nun shouldn’t stare at a penis.

pli-tv-kd20:14.1.11.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhūnaṃ āmisaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.1.eng: On one occasion people gave requisites to the monks,

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.2.eng: who then gave them to the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā attano paribhogatthāya dinnaṃ aññesaṃ dassanti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.4.eng: “How can the venerables give away to others what has been given to them for their own use?

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.5.eng: Don’t we know how to give?”

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, attano paribhogatthāya dinnaṃ aññesaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.7.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t give away to others what has been given to you for your own use.

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ āmisaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.9.eng: On one occasion the monks had an abundance of requisites.

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.11.eng: “I allow you to give to the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.14.eng: “I allow individuals to give away what belongs to them.”
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.14.comm: Thus the initial rule is overturned.

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ sannidhikataṃ āmisaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.15.eng: On one occasion the monks had an abundance of stored requisites.

pli-tv-kd20:15.1.17.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sannidhiṃ bhikkhunīhi paṭiggāhāpetvā paribhuñjitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.17.eng: “I allow what’s stored by the monks to be received and used by the nuns.”
pli-tv-kd20:15.1.17.comm: Sp 4.421: Bhikkhūnaṁ sannidhiṁ bhikkhunīhi paṭiggāhāpetvāti hiyyo paṭiggahetvā ṭhapitamaṁsaṁ ajja aññasmiṁ anupasampanne asati bhikkhūhi paṭiggāhāpetvā bhikkhunīhi paribhuñjitabbaṁ, “Bhikkhūnaṁ sannidhiṁ bhikkhunīhi paṭiggāhāpetvā: in regard to meat received yesterday by the monks, but set aside, when there is no unordained person available today, then the monks may have the nuns receive it, and it may then be used by the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhunīnaṃ āmisaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.1.eng: On one occasion people gave requisites to the nuns,

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.2.eng: who then gave them to the monks.

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo attano paribhogatthāya dinnaṃ aññesaṃ dassanti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.4.eng: “How can the nuns give away to others what has been given to them for their own use?

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.5.eng: Don’t we know how to give?”

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā attano paribhogatthāya dinnaṃ aññesaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.7.eng: “A nun shouldn’t give away to others what has been given to her for her own use.

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.8.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhunīnaṃ āmisaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.9.eng: On one occasion the nuns had an abundance of requisites.

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.11.eng: “I allow a nun to give to the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.14.eng: “I allow individuals to give away what belongs to them.”
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.14.comm: Again, the initial rule is overturned.

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhunīnaṃ sannidhikataṃ āmisaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.15.eng: On one occasion the nuns had an abundance of stored requisites.

pli-tv-kd20:15.2.17.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ sannidhiṃ bhikkhūhi paṭiggāhāpetvā paribhuñjitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:15.2.17.eng: “I allow what’s stored by the nuns to be received and used by the monks.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ ussannaṃ hoti, bhikkhunīnaṃ na hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:16.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks had an abundance of furniture, but the nuns were lacking.

pli-tv-kd20:16.1.2.eng: The nuns sent a message to the monks, saying,

pli-tv-kd20:16.1.3.pli: “sādhu, bhante, ayyā amhākaṃ senāsanaṃ dentu tāvakālikan”ti.

pli-tv-kd20:16.1.5.eng: “I allow you to lend furniture to the nuns.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena utuniyo bhikkhuniyo onaddhamañcaṃ onaddhapīṭhaṃ abhinisīdantipi abhinipajjantipi.
pli-tv-kd20:16.2.1.eng: Menstruating nuns sat down and lay down on upholstered beds and benches.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.2.eng: The furniture was stained with blood.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.4.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā onaddhamañcaṃ onaddhapīṭhaṃ abhinisīditabbaṃ abhinipajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:16.2.4.eng: “A nun shouldn’t sit down or lay down on upholstered beds or benches.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.5.pli: Yā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd20:16.2.5.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.6.comm: Āvasathacīvara literally means “a house robe”, that is, belonging to a particular house. As can be seen from Bi Pc 47:1.12.1, it was used in turn by the nuns. Vin-vn-ṭ 2300: Āvasathacīvaranti “utuniyo bhikkhuniyo paribhuñjantū”ti dinnaṁ cīvaraṁ, “Āvasathacīvara: a robe given for menstruating nuns to use.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.7.eng: The communal robe became stained with blood.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.12.eng: “I allow the nuns to attach a string and then bind it to the thigh.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.15.eng: “I allow a loin cloth and a girdle.”
pli-tv-kd20:16.2.15.comm: “Loin cloth” renders saṁvelliya. Sp 4.280: Saṁvelliyaṁ nivāsentīti mallakammakārādayo viya kacchaṁ bandhitvā nivāsenti, “Saṁvelliyaṁ nivāsenti means wearing the sarong, having bound the lower end like a wrestler or worker, etc.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.16.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sabbakālaṃ kaṭisuttakaṃ dhārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:16.2.16.eng: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six wore girdles all the time.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.18.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.20.eng: “A nun shouldn’t wear a girdle all the time.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.21.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.22.eng: I allow a nun to wear a girdle while she’s menstruating.”

pli-tv-kd20:16.2.23.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upasampannāyo dissanti—
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.1.eng: At that time the full ordination had been given to

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.2.pli: animittāpi, nimittamattāpi, alohitāpi, dhuvalohitāpi, dhuvacoḷāpi, paggharantīpi, sikharaṇīpi, itthipaṇḍakāpi, vepurisikāpi, sambhinnāpi, ubhatobyañjanāpi.
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.2.eng: women who lacked genitals, who had incomplete genitals, who did not menstruate, who menstruated continuously, who always wore menstruation pads, who were incontinent, who had genital prolapse, who lacked sexual organs, who were manlike, who had fistula, who were hermaphrodites.
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.2.comm: “Who were incontinent” renders paggharantī. Sp 1.285: Paggharantīti savantī; sadā te muttaṁ savatīti vuttaṁ hoti, “Paggharantī means flowing. It is said, ‘Their urine is always flowing.’” “Who had genital prolapse” renders sikharaṇī. Sp 1.285: Sikharaṇīti bahinikkhantaāṇimaṁsā, “Sikharaṇī means a piece of flesh is protruding outside.” “Who lacked sexual organs” renders itthipaṇḍakā. Despite leaving the uncompounded term paṇḍaka untranslated, I have opted to follow the commentarial explanation of itthipaṇḍaka. Sp 1.285: Itthipaṇḍakāti animittāva vuccati, “It is just a woman without genitals who is called an itthipaṇḍakā.” “Manlike” renders vepurisikā. Sp 1.285: Vepurisikāti samassudāṭhikā purisarūpā itthī, “Vepurisikā means a woman who has a beard and a mustache like a man.” “Who had fistula” renders sambhinnā. Sp 1.285: Sambhinnāti sambhinnavaccamaggapassāvamaggā, “Sambhinnā means the anus and the vagina are joined.” That passāvamagga, “the path of urine”, can refer to the vagina is clear from Bu Pj 1:9.1.10 where it refers to an orifice for sexual intercourse. Also, it is anatomically more likely that the anus and vagina would be conjoined, rather than the anus and the urethra.

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, upasampādentiyā catuvīsati antarāyike dhamme pucchituṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.4.eng: “The nun who is giving the full ordination should ask about twenty-four obstacles.

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.5.eng: And it should be done like this:

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.6.pli: ‘nasi animittā, nasi nimittamattā, nasi alohitā, nasi dhuvalohitā, nasi dhuvacoḷā, nasi paggharantī, nasi sikharaṇī, nasi itthipaṇḍakā, nasi vepurisikā, nasi sambhinnā, nasi ubhatobyañjanā?
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.6.eng: ‘Do you lack genitals? Are your genitals incomplete? Do you not menstruate? Do you menstruate continuously? Do you always wear a menstruation pad? Are you incontinent? Do you have genital prolapse? Do you lack sexual organs? Are you manlike? Do you have fistula? Are you a hermaphrodite?

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.7.eng: Do you have any of these diseases:

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.8.eng: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, or epilepsy?
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.8.comm: For an explanation of kuṭṭha, gaṇḍa, and kilāsa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.9.pli: Manussāsi, itthīsi, bhujissāsi, aṇaṇāsi, nasi rājabhaṭī?
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.9.eng: Are you human? Are you a woman? Are you free from slavery? Are you free from debt? Are you employed by the king?

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.10.eng: Do you have permission from your parents and husband?

pli-tv-kd20:17.1.11.pli: Paripuṇṇavīsativassāsi, paripuṇṇaṃ te pattacīvaraṃ, kiṃnāmāsi, kānāmā te pavattinī’”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:17.1.11.eng: Are you twenty years old? Do you have a full set of bowl and robes? What’s your name? What’s the name of your mentor?’”

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhikkhunīnaṃ antarāyike dhamme pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks asked the nuns about the obstacles.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.2.pli: Upasampadāpekkhāyo vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.2.eng: Those seeking the full ordination were embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekatoupasampannāya bhikkhunisaṅghe visuddhāya bhikkhusaṅghe upasampādetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.4.eng: “Only when a woman who’s free from obstacles has been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns, should you give her the full ordination in the Sangha of monks.”
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.4.comm: “Who is free from the obstacles” renders visuddhā, often translated as “pure”. In the present case, however, the contextual meaning is that she is pure of or free from the obstacles to ordination. It seems to be used synonymously with the expression parisuddhā antaryike dhamme.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ananusiṭṭhā upasampadāpekkhāyo antarāyike dhamme pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.5.eng: The nuns asked those seeking the full ordination about the obstacles without first instructing them.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.6.pli: Upasampadāpekkhāyo vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.6.eng: They were embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ anusāsitvā pacchā antarāyike dhamme pucchitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.8.eng: “The nuns should instruct first and then ask about the obstacles.”

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.9.eng: They instructed them right there in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.10.pli: Upasampadāpekkhāyo tatheva vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.10.eng: Once again those seeking the full ordination were embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.12.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekamantaṃ anusāsitvā saṅghamajjhe antarāyike dhamme pucchituṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.12.eng: “The nuns should instruct them at a distance and then ask about the obstacles in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.13.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.14.eng: First the candidate should be told to choose a preceptor.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.15.eng: Her bowl and robes should then be pointed out to her:

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.16.pli: ‘ayaṃ te patto, ayaṃ saṅghāṭi, ayaṃ uttarāsaṅgo, ayaṃ antaravāsako, idaṃ saṅkaccikaṃ, ayaṃ udakasāṭikā;
pli-tv-kd20:17.2.16.eng: ‘This is your bowl, this your outer robe, this your upper robe, this your sarong, this your chest wrap, and this your bathing robe.

pli-tv-kd20:17.2.17.eng: Now please go and stand over there.’”

pli-tv-kd20:17.3.1.eng: They were instructed by nuns who were ignorant and incompetent.

pli-tv-kd20:17.3.2.pli: Duranusiṭṭhā upasampadāpekkhāyo vitthāyanti, maṅkū honti, na sakkonti vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.3.2.eng: And because they were badly instructed, they were once again embarrassed, humiliated, and unable to respond.

pli-tv-kd20:17.3.4.eng: “A nun who’s ignorant and incompetent shouldn’t instruct.

pli-tv-kd20:17.3.5.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:17.3.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattāya bhikkhuniyā paṭibalāya anusāsitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.3.6.eng: A nun who’s competent and capable should instruct.”

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.1.eng: They instructed without having been appointed.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.3.eng: “A nun shouldn’t instruct if she hasn’t been appointed.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.4.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.5.eng: I allow a nun to instruct if she’s been appointed to do so.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.6.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.7.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ sammannitabbaṃ, parāya vā parā sammannitabbā.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.7.eng: One is either appointed through oneself or through another.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.8.eng: And how is one appointed through oneself?

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.9.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.10.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.11.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.11.comm: The Pali reads: Ayaṁ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya upasampadāpekkhā. Taking the genitive case here to be the agent genitive, which seems to be the most obvious reading, this would mean, “So-and-so who is seeking to be fully ordained by venerable so-and-so.” But it is the Sangha that ordains, not individuals, and so this translation does not seem quite right. According to Vmv 3.126 this phrase should be understood by means of this example: Ayaṁ buddharakkhito āyasmato dhammarakkhitassa saddhivihārikabhūto upasampadāpekkho, “This Buddharakkhita, who is seeking the full ordination, is the student of Venerable Dhammarakkhita.” I have followed this interpretation, and thus my translation “with venerable so-and-so”.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.12.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmaṃ anusāseyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.12.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will instruct so-and-so.’

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.14.eng: And how is one appointed through another?

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.15.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.16.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.17.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:17.4.18.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, itthannāmā itthannāmaṃ anusāseyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.18.eng: If the Sangha is ready, so-and-so will instruct so-and-so.’

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.1.pli: Tāya sammatāya bhikkhuniyā upasampadāpekkhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.1.eng: The appointed nun should go to the one seeking the full ordination and say this:

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.3.eng: Now is the time for you to tell the truth.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.4.pli: Yaṃ jātaṃ taṃ saṅghamajjhe pucchante santaṃ atthīti vattabbaṃ, asantaṃ natthīti vattabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.4.eng: You will be asked in the midst of the Sangha about various matters. If something is true, you should say, “Yes,” and if it’s not, you should say, “No.”

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.5.pli: Mā kho vitthāyi, mā kho maṅku ahosi.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.6.eng: This is what they’ll ask you:

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.7.pli: nasi animittā, nasi nimittamattā, nasi alohitā, nasi dhuvalohitā, nasi dhuvacoḷā, nasi paggharantī, nasi sikharaṇī, nasi itthipaṇḍakā, nasi vepurisikā, nasi sambhinnā, nasi ubhatobyañjanā?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.7.eng: “Do you lack genitals? Are your genitals incomplete? Do you not menstruate? Do you menstruate continuously? Do you always wear a menstruation pad? Are you incontinent? Do you have genital prolapse? Do you lack sexual organs? Are you manlike? Do you have fistula? Are you a hermaphrodite?

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.8.eng: Do you have any of these diseases:

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.9.eng: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, or epilepsy?

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.10.pli: Manussāsi, itthīsi, bhujissāsi, aṇaṇāsi, nasi rājabhaṭī?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.10.eng: Are you human? Are you a woman? Are you free from slavery? Are you free from debt? Are you employed by the king?

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.11.eng: Do you have permission from your parents and husband?

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.12.pli: Paripuṇṇavīsativassāsi, paripuṇṇaṃ te pattacīvaraṃ, kiṃnāmāsi, kānāmā te pavattinī’ti?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.12.eng: Are you twenty years old? Do you have a full set of bowl and robes? What’s your name? What’s the name of your mentor?”’”

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.13.eng: They then returned to the Sangha together.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.15.eng: The instructor should return first and inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.16.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.17.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.19.eng: If the Sangha is ready, so-and-so should come.’

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.20.eng: And she should be told to come.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.21.pli: Ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā upasampadaṃ yācāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.21.eng: She should then arrange her upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the nuns, squat on her heels, and raise her joined palms. She should then ask for the full ordination:

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.22.eng: ‘Venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.23.pli: Ullumpatu maṃ, ayye, saṅgho anukampaṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.23.eng: Please lift me up out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.24.eng: For the second time, venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.25.eng: Please lift me up out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd20:17.5.27.eng: Please lift me up out of compassion.’

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.1.pli: Tāvadeva taṃ ādāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vandāpetvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā upasampadaṃ yācāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.1.eng: Straightaway she should be taken to the Sangha of monks. She should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on her heels, and raise her joined palms. She should then ask for the full ordination:

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.2.eng: ‘Venerables, I’m seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.3.eng: I’m free from obstacles and have been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.3.comm: “Who is free from the obstacles” renders visuddhā, often translated as “pure”. In the present case, however, the contextual meaning is that she is pure of or free from the obstacles to ordination. It seems to be used synonymously with the expression parisuddhā antaryikehi dhammehi above.

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.4.eng: I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.5.eng: Please lift me up out of compassion.
