pli-tv-kd20:17.8.39.pli: Tāvadeva chāyā metabbā, utuppamāṇaṃ ācikkhitabbaṃ, divasabhāgo ācikkhitabbo, saṅgīti ācikkhitabbā, bhikkhuniyo vattabbā—
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.39.eng: Straightaway the time should be noted and the date should be pointed out. These should be declared jointly to everyone.
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.39.comm: Saṅgīti ācikkhitabbā, literally, “a joint recitation is to be declared”, which is rather cryptic. Sp 3.128: Saṅgītīti idameva sabbaṁ ekato katvā “tvaṁ kiṁ labhasi, kā te chāyā, kiṁ utuppamāṇaṁ, ko divasabhāgo”ti puṭṭho “idaṁ nāma labhāmi – vassaṁ vā hemantaṁ vā gimhaṁ vā, ayaṁ me chāyā, idaṁ utuppamāṇaṁ, ayaṁ divasabhāgoti vadeyyāsī”ti evaṁ ācikkhitabbaṁ, “Saṅgīti: here it means: having brought everyone together, it should pointed out: ‘When you are asked, “What did you have: what was your time; what was your date?” you should reply, “I had this: it was the rainy season/the cold season/the hot season; it was this time; it was this date.”’” The point seems to be that a newly ordained nun should remember the time and date of her ordination so that she may respond to questions about it in future. In the above, the word “date” renders the combined meaning of utuppamāṇa and divasabhāga. Vmv 3.128: Chāyādikameva sabbaṁ saṅgahetvā gāyitabbato kathetabbato saṅgītīti āha “idamevā”tiādi. Tattha ekato katvā ācikkhitabbaṁ. Tvaṁ kiṁ labhasīti tvaṁ upasampādanakāle kataravassaṁ, katarautuñca labhasi, katarasmiṁ te upasampadā laddhāti attho, “‘Here’ etc. means: having collected all—that is the time, etc.—saṅgīti is said because it is to be chanted, because it is to be declared. In regard to this, having brought (everyone) together, it is to be pointed out. ‘What did you have’ means: at the time of the ordination, what was your year and season; your ordination was obtained in which one?”

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.40.pli: imissā tayo ca nissaye, aṭṭha ca akaraṇīyāni ācikkheyyāthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.40.eng: The nuns should be told to point out the three supports and the eight things not to be done.”
pli-tv-kd20:17.8.40.comm: That is, the nuns who did the ordination should point this out to those who have just been ordained. Vmv 4.425: Tayo nissayeti rukkhamūlasenāsanassa tāsaṁ alabbhanato vuttaṁ, “Tayo nissaye: this is said because they do not obtain a resting place at the foot of a tree.”

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo bhattagge āsanaṃ saṅkasāyantiyo kālaṃ vītināmesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.1.eng: On one occasion the right time for eating passed while the nuns were trying to find the right seats in the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.1.comm: Sp 4.426: Āsanaṁ saṁkasāyantiyo kālaṁ vītināmesunti aññaṁ vuṭṭhāpetvā aññaṁ nisīdāpentiyo bhojanakālaṁ atikkāmesuṁ, “Āsanaṁ saṁkasāyantiyo kālaṁ vītināmesuṁ: making (nuns) get up and sit down, they went beyond the time for eating.”

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aṭṭhannaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, avasesānaṃ yathāgatikan”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.3.eng: “I allow eight nuns to be seated according to seniority, but the rest according to their time of arrival.”
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.3.comm: Sp 4.426: Aṭṭhannaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ yathāvuḍḍhanti ettha sace pure aṭṭhasu nisinnāsu tāsaṁ abbhantarimā aññā āgacchati, sā attano navakaṁ uṭṭhāpetvā nisīdituṁ labhati. Yā pana aṭṭhahipi navakatarā, sā sacepi saṭṭhivassā hoti, āgatapaṭipāṭiyāva nisīdituṁ labhati, “Aṭṭhannaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ yathāvuḍḍhaṁ: here, if another nun arrives who belongs (seniority-wise) among the first eight nuns who are seated, she may make a nun junior to her get up and then sit down. But whoever is junior to the eight, even if she has sixty years seniority, should sit down in accordance with the order of arrival.”

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.5.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātaṃ aṭṭhannaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, avasesānaṃ yathāgatikan”ti—

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.6.pli: sabbattha aṭṭheva bhikkhuniyo yathāvuḍḍhaṃ paṭibāhanti, avasesāyo yathāgatikaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.6.eng: eight nuns reserved places everywhere according to seniority, the rest getting places according to their time of arrival.

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhattagge aṭṭhannaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, avasesānaṃ yathāgatikaṃ;
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.8.eng: “I allow eight nuns to be seated in the dining hall according to seniority and the rest according to their time of arrival,
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.8.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “dining hall” for bhattagga, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:18.1.10.eng: If a nun makes a reservation anywhere apart from the dining hall, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo na pavārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.1.eng: At that time the nuns did not do the invitation ceremony.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “invitation ceremony” for pavāreti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.3.eng: “A nun should do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.4.eng: If she doesn’t, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo attanā pavāretvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na pavārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.5.eng: At that time the nuns did the invitation ceremony among themselves, but not with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā attanā pavāretvā bhikkhusaṅgho na pavāretabbo.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.7.eng: “After doing the invitation ceremony with the nuns, a nun should do the invitation ceremony with the monks.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.8.eng: If she doesn’t, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ ekato pavārentiyo kolāhalaṃ akaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.9.eng: The nuns did their invitation ceremony together with the monks. They made a racket.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.9.comm: The point seems to be that the nuns did their own invitation ceremony in the presence of the monks. The appropriate procedure, however, is to do it first among themselves, and only then with the monks.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.11.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ ekato pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.11.eng: “The nuns shouldn’t do their invitation ceremony together with the monks.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.12.eng: Any nun who does commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo purebhattaṃ pavārentiyo kālaṃ vītināmesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.13.eng: On one occasion when the nuns did the invitation ceremony before the meal, they did not finish until after the time for eating.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.15.eng: “I allow the nuns to do the invitation ceremony after the meal.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.16.eng: Doing the invitation ceremony after the meal, they did not finish until it was too late in the evening.

pli-tv-kd20:19.1.18.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ajjatanā bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ pavāretvā aparajju bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pavāretun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.18.eng: “I allow the nuns to do the invitation ceremony among themselves on one day and with the monks on the following day.”

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sabbo bhikkhunisaṅgho pavārento kolāhalaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.1.eng: At that time the whole Sangha of nuns did the invitation ceremony. They made a racket.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekaṃ bhikkhuniṃ byattaṃ paṭibalaṃ sammannituṃ—
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.3.eng: “I allow the nuns to appoint one capable and competent nun

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.4.eng: to do the invitation ceremony with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.5.eng: She should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.6.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhunī yācitabbā, yācitvā byattāya bhikkhuniyā paṭibalāya saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.6.eng: First a nun should be asked, and then a competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammanneyya bhikkhunisaṅghassa atthāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pavāretuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint nun so-and-so to do the invitation ceremony with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.11.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannati bhikkhunisaṅghassa atthāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pavāretuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.11.eng: The Sangha appoints nun so-and-so to do the invitation ceremony with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.12.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā sammuti bhikkhunisaṅghassa atthāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pavāretuṃ, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.12.eng: Any nun who approves of appointing nun so-and-so to do the invitation ceremony with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.13.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.14.pli: Sammatā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī bhikkhunisaṅghassa atthāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pavāretuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.14.eng: The Sangha has appointed nun so-and-so to do the invitation ceremony with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:19.2.15.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.15.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.1.pli: Tāya sammatāya bhikkhuniyā bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ ādāya bhikkhusaṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.1.eng: The appointed nun should take the Sangha of nuns to the Sangha of monks. She should then arrange her upper robe over one shoulder, squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.2.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.3.pli: diṭṭhena vā, sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.3.eng: what you’ve seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.4.pli: Vadatu, ayyā, bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ anukampaṃ upādāya, passanto paṭikarissati.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.4.eng: Please correct the Sangha of nuns, venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.4.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “correct” for vadati, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.5.eng: For the second time, the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning what you’ve seen, heard, or suspect. Please correct the Sangha of nuns, venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.6.eng: For the third time, the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.7.pli: diṭṭhena vā, sutena vā, parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.7.eng: what you’ve seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd20:19.3.8.pli: Vadatu, ayyā, bhikkhusaṅgho bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ anukampaṃ upādāya, passanto paṭikarissatī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.8.eng: Please correct the Sangha of nuns, venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.’”

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.0.eng: Mutual authority between monks and nuns

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ uposathaṃ ṭhapenti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapenti, savacanīyaṃ karonti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapenti, okāsaṃ kārenti, codenti, sārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.1.eng: At that time the nuns canceled the monks’ observance-day ceremony and their invitation ceremony; they directed them, gave them instructions, got permission from them to correct them, accused them of offenses, and reminded them of offenses.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.1.comm: Sp 4.76: Na savacanīyaṁ kātabbanti palibodhatthāya vā pakkosanatthāya vā savacanīyaṁ na kātabbaṁ, palibodhatthāya hi karonto “ahaṁ āyasmantaṁ imasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ savacanīyaṁ karomi, imamhā āvāsā ekapadampi mā pakkāmi, yāva na taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vūpasantaṁ hotī”ti evaṁ karoti. Pakkosanatthāya karonto “ahaṁ te savacanīyaṁ karomi, ehi mayā saddhiṁ vinayadharānaṁ sammukhībhāvaṁ gacchāmā”ti evaṁ karoti; tadubhayampi na kātabbaṁ, “Na savacanīyaṁ kātabba: savacanīya is not to be done for the purpose of (creating) an obstacle or for the purpose of summoning. Acting for the purpose of (creating) an obstacle is done like this: ‘I am doing savacanīya against the venerable in regard to this offense: he must not depart from this monastery even with one foot so long as this legal issue has not been resolved.’ Acting for the purpose of summoning is done like this: ‘I am doing savacanīya against you: come with me and let us go to the presence of a master of the Monastic Law.’ Neither of these is to be done.” Sp-ṭ 4.76: Savacanīyanti sadosaṁ, “Savacanīyan: with flaw.” Vmv 4.76: Savacanīyanti ettha “sadosa”nti atthaṁ vadati. Attano vacane pavattanakammanti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo, “mā pakkamāhī”ti vā “ehi vinayadharānaṁ sammukhībhāva”nti vā evaṁ attano āṇāya pavattanakakammaṁ na kātabbanti adhippāyo, “Savacanīyan: here he says the meaning is ‘with flaw’. Here the meaning is to be understood as bringing about an action when speaking oneself: ‘Don’t leave,’ ‘Come to the presence of a master of the Monastic Law’. The intention is one is not to do the bringing about an action in this way because of a command from oneself.” Okāsaṁ kārenti literally means “they have (the other) make an opportunity”. The idiomatic meaning is “they get permission” or usually “they get permission from someone to correct them”. For the sake of clarity, I use both of these renderings depending on the context.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.3.eng: “A nun shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a monk.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.4.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.5.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.6.eng: A nun shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a monk.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.7.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.8.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.9.eng: A nun shouldn’t direct a monk.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.10.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.11.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.12.eng: A nun shouldn’t give instructions to a monk.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.13.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.14.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.15.eng: A nun shouldn’t get permission from a monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.16.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.17.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.18.eng: A nun shouldn’t accuse a monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.19.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.20.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.21.eng: A nun shouldn’t remind a monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.22.eng: If she does, it’s not valid,

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.23.eng: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.24.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhikkhunīnaṃ uposathaṃ ṭhapenti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapenti, savacanīyaṃ karonti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapenti, okāsaṃ kārenti, codenti, sārenti.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.24.eng: At that time the monks canceled the nuns’ observance-day ceremony and their invitation ceremony; they directed them, gave them instructions, got permission from them to correct them, accused them of offenses, and reminded them of offenses.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.26.eng: “A monk may cancel the observance-day ceremony of a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.28.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.29.eng: A monk may cancel the invitation ceremony of a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.31.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.32.eng: A monk may direct a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.34.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.35.eng: A monk may give instructions to a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.37.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.38.eng: A monk may get permission from a nun to correct her.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.40.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.41.eng: A monk may accuse a nun of an offense.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.43.eng: and there’s no offense for him.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.44.eng: A monk may remind a nun of an offense.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.46.eng: and there’s no offense for him.”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo yānena yāyanti—
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.1.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six traveled in vehicles,

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.2.eng: sometimes pulled by women with men inside, at other times pulled by men with women inside.

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.4.eng: “You’d think they were at the Ganges festival!”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.6.eng: “A nun shouldn’t travel in a vehicle.

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.7.eng: If she does, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti, na sakkoti padasā gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.8.eng: Soon afterwards there was a sick nun who was unable to go on foot.

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.10.eng: “I allow a vehicle for one who is sick.”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.12.eng: “A vehicle pulled by women or by men?”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.14.eng: “I allow a rickshaw pulled either by men or by women.”

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā bhikkhuniyā yānugghātena bāḷhataraṃ aphāsu ahosi.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.15.eng: Soon afterwards a certain nun was even more uncomfortable when jolted around in a vehicle.

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.17.eng: “I allow a palanquin and a litter.”

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aḍḍhakāsī gaṇikā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:22.1.1.eng: At that time the courtesan Aḍḍhakāsī had gone forth with the nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.2.eng: She wanted to go to Sāvatthī

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.3.eng: to get the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.9.eng: she sent a message to the Buddha, saying,

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd20:22.1.12.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd20:22.1.13.eng: “I allow you to give the full ordination also by messenger.”

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.1.eng: They ordained with a monk as messenger.

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination with a monk as messenger.

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.5.eng: They ordained with a trainee nun as messenger …

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.6.eng: They ordained with a novice monk as messenger …

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.7.eng: They ordained with a novice nun as messenger …

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.8.eng: They ordained with an ignorant and incompetent nun as messenger.

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.9.eng: “You shouldn’t give the full ordination with an ignorant and incompetent nun as messenger.

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:22.2.11.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, byattāya bhikkhuniyā paṭibalāya dūtena upasampādetunti.
pli-tv-kd20:22.2.11.eng: You should give the full ordination with a capable and competent nun as messenger.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.1.pli: Tāya dūtāya bhikkhuniyā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.1.eng: That messenger nun should go to the Sangha, arrange her upper robe over one shoulder, bow down at the feet of the monks, squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.2.eng: ‘Venerables, so-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.3.eng: She is free from obstacles and has been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.3.comm: These are the obstacles mentioned in the ordination ceremony as described above.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.4.eng: She hasn’t come because of an obstruction.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.5.eng: She asks the Sangha for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.6.pli: Ullumpatu taṃ, ayyā, saṅgho anukampaṃ upādāya.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.6.eng: Please lift her up out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.9.eng: She hasn’t come because of an obstruction.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.11.eng: Please lift her up out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.12.eng: Venerables, so-and-so is seeking the full ordination with venerable so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.13.eng: She is free from obstacles and has been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.14.eng: She hasn’t come because of an obstruction.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.15.pli: Tatiyampi, ayyā, itthannāmā saṅghaṃ upasampadaṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.15.eng: For the third time, she asks the Sangha for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.16.pli: Ullumpatu taṃ, ayyā, saṅgho anukampaṃ upādāyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.16.eng: Please lift her up out of compassion.’

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.17.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.18.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.19.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.20.eng: She is free from obstacles and has been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.21.eng: She’s not present because of an obstruction.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.22.eng: So-and-so is asking the Sangha for the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.23.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ upasampādeyya itthannāmāya pavattiniyā.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.23.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give her the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.25.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.26.eng: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.27.eng: She is free from obstacles and has been fully ordained on one side in the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.28.eng: She’s not present because of an obstruction.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.29.eng: So-and-so is asking the Sangha for the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.30.eng: The Sangha gives her the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.31.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmāya upasampadā itthannāmāya pavattiniyā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.31.eng: Any monk who approves of giving so-and-so the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.32.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

Any monk who approves of giving so-and-so the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor should remain silent. Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.41.eng: Any monk who approves of giving so-and-so the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.43.eng: The Sangha has given so-and-so the full ordination with so-and-so as her mentor.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.44.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.44.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.45.pli: Tāvadeva chāyā metabbā, utuppamāṇaṃ ācikkhitabbaṃ, divasabhāgo ācikkhitabbo, saṅgīti ācikkhitabbā, bhikkhuniyo vattabbā—
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.45.eng: Straightaway the time should be noted and the date should be pointed out. These should be declared jointly to everyone.

pli-tv-kd20:22.3.46.pli: tassā tayo ca nissaye, aṭṭha ca akaraṇīyāni ācikkheyyāthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:22.3.46.eng: The nuns should be told to point out the three supports and the eight things not to be done to the newly ordained nun.”

pli-tv-kd20:23.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo araññe viharanti.
pli-tv-kd20:23.1.1.eng: At that time nuns were staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd20:23.1.2.comm: The word dūseti has a wide application, but in this sort of context it seems to mean “rape”. Commenting on the related term (bhikkhunī-)dūsaka, Sp 3.115 says: Bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhaveti ettha yo pakatattaṁ bhikkhuniṁ tiṇṇaṁ maggānaṁ aññatarasmiṁ dūseti, ayaṁ bhikkhunidūsako nāma, “Bhikkhunidūsako bhikkhave: in this context it means whoever violates an ordinary nun through one of three orifices (vagina, anus, or mouth) is called a bhikkhunidūsaka.” See also discussion of dūsaka in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:23.1.4.eng: “A nun shouldn’t stay in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd20:23.1.5.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:24.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena upāsakena bhikkhunisaṅghassa uddosito dinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:24.1.1.eng: On one occasion a lay follower gave a storehouse to the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-kd20:24.1.6.comm: It’s a bit unexpected that the text jumps from outbuilding to dwelling place. Perhaps these buildings were multipurpose, and the overall number was insufficient.

pli-tv-kd20:24.1.9.comm: Sp 4.431 explains: Navakammanti saṅghassatthāya bhikkhuniyā navakammampi kātuṁ anujānāmīti attho, “‘Building work’: the meaning is ‘I allow the nuns to build for the benefit of the Sangha.’”

pli-tv-kd20:24.1.12.eng: “I allow you to build for individuals.”

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī sannisinnagabbhā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.1.eng: At one time a pregnant woman went forth as a nun.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.4.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho mayā imasmiṃ dārake paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.4.eng: what to do with the baby boy.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.6.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, posetuṃ, yāva so dārako viññutaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.6.eng: “I allow you to rear him until he becomes self-reliant.”
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.6.comm: Yāva so dārako viññutaṁ pāpuṇāti, literally, “until the boy reaches discernment”. Sp 4.432: Yāva so dārako viññutaṁ pāpuṇātīti yāva khādituṁ bhuñjituṁ nahāyituñca maṇḍituñca attano dhammatāya sakkotīti attho, “Yāva so dārako viññutaṁ pāpuṇāti means until he is able to eat, bathe, and groom himself.”

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.8.pli: “mayā ca na labbhā ekikāya vatthuṃ, aññāya ca bhikkhuniyā na labbhā dārakena saha vatthuṃ, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.8.eng: “I’m not allowed to stay by myself and other nuns are not allowed to stay with a male child. What should I do now?”
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.8.comm: That she is unable to stay by herself probably refers to Bi Ss 3:4.14.1.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.10.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannitvā tassā bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.10.eng: “The nuns should appoint a nun as her companion.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.11.eng: And she should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.12.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhunī yācitabbā, yācitvā byattāya bhikkhuniyā paṭibalāya saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.12.eng: First a nun should be asked, and then a capable and competent nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.13.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.14.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammanneyya itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.14.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.16.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.17.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.17.eng: The Sangha appoints nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.18.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā sammuti itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.18.eng: Any nun who approves of appointing nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.19.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.20.pli: Sammatā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyā.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.20.eng: The Sangha has appointed nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.1.21.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:25.1.21.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd20:25.2.1.pli: Atha kho tassā dutiyikāya bhikkhuniyā etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd20:25.2.2.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho mayā imasmiṃ dārake paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:25.2.2.eng: “How should I act in regard to this boy?”

pli-tv-kd20:25.2.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā sāgāraṃ yathā aññasmiṃ purise paṭipajjanti evaṃ tasmiṃ dārake paṭipajjitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:25.2.4.eng: “Apart from staying in the same dwelling, the companion nun should act toward him as she would toward any other male.”
pli-tv-kd20:25.2.4.comm: Sp 4.432: Ṭhapetvā sāgāranti sahagāraseyyamattaṁ ṭhapetvā, “Ṭhapetvā sāgāra: apart from a mere sleeping place in the same house.”

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī garudhammaṃ ajjhāpannā hoti mānattacārinī.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.1.eng: On one occasion a nun who had committed a heavy offense was undertaking the trial period.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.3.pli: “mayā ca na labbhā ekikāya vatthuṃ, aññāya ca bhikkhuniyā na labbhā saha mayā vatthuṃ, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.3.eng: “I’m not allowed to stay by myself and other nuns are not allowed to stay with me. What should I do now?”
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.3.comm: In other words, there is a conflict between Bi Ss 3:4.14.1, according to which a nun cannot stay by herself, and the rules for the trial period, mānatta, according to which a nun cannot stay together with another nun, see Kd 12:5.1.63–5.1.65.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.5.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannitvā tassā bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.5.eng: “You should appoint a nun as her companion.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.6.eng: And she should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.7.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhunī yācitabbā, yācitvā byattāya bhikkhuniyā paṭibalāya saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.7.eng: First a nun should be asked, and then a capable and competent nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammanneyya itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.12.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ sammannati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.12.eng: The Sangha appoints nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.13.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā sammuti itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.13.eng: Any nun who approves of appointing nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.14.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.15.pli: Sammatā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dutiyā.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.15.eng: The Sangha has appointed nun so-and-so as a companion to nun so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd20:25.3.16.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:25.3.16.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd20:26.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya vibbhami.
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.1.eng: On one occasion a nun verbally renounced the training and disrobed.
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “disrobe” for vibbhamati, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd20:26.1.2.pli: Sā puna paccāgantvā bhikkhuniyo upasampadaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.2.eng: Later she returned and asked the nuns for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:26.1.4.eng: “A nun can’t verbally renounce the training.
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.4.comm: The difference between “verbally renouncing” and “disrobing” just below is that disrobal refers to the act of literally removing one’s robes.

pli-tv-kd20:26.1.5.pli: yadeva sā vibbhantā tadeva sā abhikkhunī”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.5.eng: When she disrobes, she is no longer a nun.”
pli-tv-kd20:26.1.5.comm: “Disrobes” renders vibbhantā. See Appendix of Technical Terms. for a brief discussion of this word. Sp 4.434: Sā puna upasampadaṁ na labhati, “She does not obtain the full ordination again”. Yet this commentarial statement has no basis in the Canonical texts. In fact it contrasts with the immediately following case, in the Canonical text, of a nun who returns after joining another religious community. In this case it is explicitly stated that she cannot reordain. The fact that this is not explicitly stated in the present case seems to suggest that she can reordain after disrobing.

pli-tv-kd20:26.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī sakāvāsā titthāyatanaṃ saṅkami.
pli-tv-kd20:26.2.1.eng: On one occasion a nun joined another religious community while still wearing her robes.
pli-tv-kd20:26.2.1.comm: I read sakāsāva with SRT, the Sri Lankan Buddha Jayantī Tipiṭaka, and the PTS edition, instead of sakāvāsa.

pli-tv-kd20:26.2.2.pli: Sā puna paccāgantvā bhikkhuniyo upasampadaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd20:26.2.2.eng: Later she returned and asked the nuns for the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd20:26.2.4.pli: “Yā sā, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī sakāvāsā titthāyatanaṃ saṅkantā, sā āgatā na upasampādetabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:26.2.4.eng: “If a nun goes over to another religious community while still wearing her robes and then returns, she shouldn’t be given the full ordination again.”
pli-tv-kd20:26.2.4.comm: That is, she has gone over to the other religion without first disrobing.

pli-tv-kd20:27.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo purisehi abhivādanaṃ, kesacchedanaṃ, nakhacchedanaṃ, vaṇappaṭikammaṃ, kukkuccāyantā na sādiyanti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.1.1.eng: At that time the nuns, being afraid of wrongdoing, did not consent to men bowing down to them, or to men shaving their heads, cutting their nails, or treating their sores.

pli-tv-kd20:27.1.3.eng: “I allow you to consent to these things.”

pli-tv-kd20:27.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo pallaṅkena nisīdanti paṇhisamphassaṃ sādiyantī.
pli-tv-kd20:27.2.1.eng: At that time the nuns were sitting cross-legged, enjoying the touch of their heels.

pli-tv-kd20:27.2.4.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd20:27.2.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.2.5.eng: On one occasion there was a sick nun

pli-tv-kd20:27.2.6.pli: Tassā vinā pallaṅkena na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.2.6.eng: who was not comfortable without sitting cross-legged.

pli-tv-kd20:27.2.8.eng: “I allow a nun to sit half-cross-legged.”
pli-tv-kd20:27.2.8.comm: That is, “cross-legged” with one leg. This posture is perhaps similar to the “polite posture”, puppeap, used in Thailand.

pli-tv-kd20:27.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo vaccakuṭiyā vaccaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.3.1.eng: At that time the nuns were using a restroom for defecating.

pli-tv-kd20:27.3.2.eng: And the nuns from the group of six performed abortions there.

pli-tv-kd20:27.3.4.eng: “A nun shouldn’t defecate in a restroom.

pli-tv-kd20:27.3.5.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:27.3.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, heṭṭhā vivaṭe uparipaṭicchanne vaccaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.3.6.eng: I allow the nuns to defecate in a place that’s open underneath but concealed on top.”

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo cuṇṇena nahāyanti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.4.1.eng: At that time the nuns were bathing with bath powder.

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.3.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.5.eng: “A nun shouldn’t bathe with bath powder.

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.6.eng: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo vāsitakāya mattikāya nahāyanti.
pli-tv-kd20:27.4.8.eng: At that time the nuns were bathing with scented clay.

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.10.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd20:27.4.12.eng: “A nun shouldn’t bathe with scented clay.
